description: AI cannot playtest games - no input simulation in Layer 3
rootCause: The Unity-MCP bridge has no tool to simulate physics-based mouse input. OnMouseDown() requires actual Unity Input events that trigger Physics.Raycast. Current MCP tools only support UI EventSystem raycasting, not world-space physics raycasting.
observedBehavior: Playtest Polecat verified initial state (score 0/10, target spawned)
Could not simulate clicking the target
expectedBehavior: AI should be able to simulate mouse clicks at world positions
Physics.Raycast should detect the simulated input
Full game loop playable by AI

layerFaultAttribution.L3: Yes - Input simulation missing from MCP tools

proposedFixes: Option A: Add IPlaytestService to Layer 3 that can invoke click handlers programmatically
Option B: Add public Click() method to all clickable components alongside OnMouseDown
Option C: Create custom MCP tool that simulates Input.mousePosition + Physics.Raycast
Option D: Use Unity Test Framework's InputTestFixture for PlayMode tests
prevention: All interactive components should implement IClickable interface with programmatic Click() method for AI testing
